page.syntax: Output_Filename as C = : Object_Type.Send(c layoutname [,c format [,c filter [,c order [,c email_client [,c _to [,c subject [,c message [,c cc [,c bcc [,* printoptions[,arguments as SQL::Arguments] ]]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Object_Type
argument.description: This word can be any of the following:

argument.name: layoutname
argument.description: The name of a form, browse, label, letter, or report layout.

argument.name: format
argument.description: Optional. Default = native format. The options for Format are:

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = all records. An expression that selects records.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = record number order. An expression that orders selected records.

argument.name: email_client
argument.description: Optional. Default = your default email client. "Default" = Your default email client. "A5" = Internal email client.

argument.name: _to
argument.description: Optional. Comma delimited list of addresses.

argument.name: subject
argument.description: Optional. Default = "See report: Layout_Name ". The subject of the message. If you want to completely suppress the subject, specify the subject as: " "

argument.name: cc
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". Comma delimited list of addresses.

argument.name: bcc
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". Comma delimited list of addresses.

argument.name: printoptions
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL. You can override the default system settings on a permanent basis. When you override the system defaults, you settings are stored in a text file in the Alpha Anywhere program folder. These files are named:

item.name: For more information see print options and LAYOUT.SAVEAS().

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL. Arguments that retrieve value(s) from variable(s) or prompts for value(s) at runtime. Only applicable to SQL Reports. Refer to SQL::Arguments Object.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL_VALUE(). Sets filter (WHERE) and order (ORDER BY) expressions for a query against a passive-linked table. A pointer dot variable with 2 elements. Refer to Using the Options Argument.

item.name: .filter = Adds to the WHERE clause in the underlying SQL expression.
.order = Replaces the ORDER BY clause in the underlying SQL expression.

page.discussion: The <OBJECT>.SEND() method emails a layout as an attached file of type Format. Email is sent using your default email client if Email_Client is blank. You can explicitly set the email client to "Default" or "A5" by setting Email_Client to "Default" or "A5". Note : This method requires that the user press the Send key to complete the transmission. as a result <OBJECT>.SEND()is not appropriate for use in web applications. To send a report as an attachment without user interaction, create the attachment with REPORT.SAVEAS() and send it with EMAIL_SEND() or EMAIL_SEND2(). Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: Email a report in PDF format.
This script sends a copy of the Invoice report with an argument. You can add as many arguments to the arguments collection as you want.
section.example: DIM myargs as SQL::arguments myargs.add("whatcity", "London") report.send("Invoice", "PDF", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", NULL_VALUE(), myargs)
